results.doc_title: One Time Purchase - Analytical Data Brief
results.summary: HelloFresh Group is implementing One-Time-Purchase (OTP) capabilities across its brands to move beyond subscription-only models and address customer hesitation around long-term commitments. The initiative aims to generate €24.7M-€28.8M in incremental revenue through a unified purchasing experience across Good Chop, VMS, and Seasonal Boxes, with staggered launches from September to November 2025.
key_points: OTP feature addresses limited purchasing flexibility that has deterred potential customers and past subscribers
Projected revenue impact of €24.7M to €28.8M in Total Customer Value Added (TCVA)
Staggered launch schedule: Good Chop (US) in Sep 2025, Seasonal Boxes (AU/NZ) in Oct 2025, VMS (US) in Nov 2025
Solution includes unified user flow, transparent pricing, distinct cart/checkout processes, and integrated order management
Initiative supports cross-selling opportunities (Factor meals), Good Chop integration, and future two-way marketplace
Current status: In progress with multiple product managers assigned to different brand implementations
decisions: Moving from subscription-only to include one-time purchase model
Creating unified OTP user flow across HelloFresh Group brands
Starting Seasonal Boxes rollout globally with AU and NZ markets first
Implementing differentiated user types: Prospect-user, OTP-user, Subscription-user, and Hybrid-user
action_items: Complete review of OTP success metrics (assigned to ferran.punet@hellofresh.com, dvo@hellofresh.com, sameer.doda@hellofresh.ca)
Determine frontend tracking requirements for OTP prospects
Create parameter to check if users have an OTP order
Specify all events needing box_type parameter for implementation (assigned to akar@hellofresh.com)
Clarify delivery handle availability and address relationship (question to crui@hellofresh.com)

results.doc_title: One Time Purchase - Analytical Data Brief
results.summary: HelloFresh Group is implementing One-Time-Purchase (OTP) capabilities across its brands to move beyond subscription-only models and address customer flexibility concerns. The initiative aims to generate €24.7M-€28.8M in incremental revenue through unified purchasing flows for Good Chop, VMS, and Seasonal Boxes, with staggered launches from September to November 2025.
key_points: OTP initiative addresses customer hesitation about long-term subscription commitments and fragmented purchasing experiences
Projected revenue impact of €24.7M-€28.8M in Total Customer Value Added (TCVA)
Staggered launch schedule: Good Chop US (Sep 2025), Seasonal Boxes Global starting AU/NZ (Oct 2025), VMS US (Nov 2025)
Solution includes unified user flow, transparent pricing, distinct cart/checkout processes, and integrated order management
Supports 2025 OKRs including scaling Good Chop to $180M ARR and achieving 15,690 net conversions for Factor Form
Enables cross-selling opportunities (Factor meals) and supports future two-way marketplace
decisions: Moving from subscription-only to include one-time purchase model across HelloFresh Group brands
Implementing unified OTP flow rather than separate microsites for different products
Launching in phases across different brands and regions starting September 2025

Determine frontend tracking requirements for OTP prospects
Create parameter to check if users have an OTP order
Specify all events needing box_type parameter for implementation (assigned to akar@hellofresh.com)
Clarify delivery handle availability and address relationship (question to crui@hellofresh.com)

results.doc_title: One Time Purchase - Analytical Data Brief
results.summary: HelloFresh Group is implementing One-Time-Purchase (OTP) capabilities across multiple brands to move beyond subscription-only models and address customer flexibility concerns. The initiative aims to generate €24.7M-€28.8M in incremental revenue through unified purchasing flows for Good Chop, VMS, and Seasonal Boxes, with staggered launches from September to November 2025.
key_points: OTP feature addresses customer hesitation about long-term subscription commitments and replaces fragmented microsite-based one-off sales
Projected revenue impact of €24.7M-€28.8M in Total Customer Value Added (TCVA) from seasonal boxes and Good Chop experiments
Phased rollout: Good Chop US (Sep 2025), Seasonal Boxes Global starting AU/NZ (Oct 2025), VMS US (Nov 2025)
Solution includes unified user flow, transparent pricing, distinct cart/checkout, SKU management, and integrated order management
Supports strategic goals including Good Chop scaling to $180M ARR and Factor achieving 15,690 net conversions by end of 2025
Requires new data tracking for different user-subscription types (prospects, OTP-only customers, subscription customers)
decisions: Moving from subscription-only to include one-time-purchase model across HelloFresh Group brands
Creating unified OTP user flow instead of separate microsites
Implementing staggered launch schedule across three product lines and regions
Will only count net activations for subscription conversion metrics
action_items: Complete review of OTP success metrics (assigned to ferran.punet@hellofresh.com, dvo@hellofresh.com, sameer.doda@hellofresh.ca)
Specify all events needing box_type parameter for implementation (assigned to akar@hellofresh.com)
Create parameter to check if users have an OTP order for frontend tracking
Clarify delivery handle availability at implementation stage (question to crui@hellofresh.com)
Determine treatment of users who convert to subscription but don't receive a box

results.doc_title: One Time Purchase - Analytical Data Brief
results.summary: HelloFresh Group is implementing One-Time-Purchase (OTP) capabilities across its brands to move beyond subscription-only models and address customer flexibility concerns. The initiative aims to generate €24.7M-€28.8M in incremental revenue through unified purchasing flows for Good Chop, VMS, and Seasonal Boxes, with staggered launches from September to November 2025.
key_points: OTP feature addresses customer hesitation about long-term subscription commitments and replaces fragmented microsite-based one-off sales
Projected revenue impact of €24.7M-€28.8M in Total Customer Value Added (TCVA) from seasonal boxes and Good Chop experiments
Staggered launch schedule: Good Chop US (Sep 2025), Seasonal Boxes Global starting AU/NZ (Oct 2025), VMS US (Nov 2025)
Solution includes unified user flow, transparent pricing, distinct cart/checkout processes, and integrated order management
Key 2025 OKRs include scaling Good Chop to $180M ARR and achieving 15,690 net conversions for Factor Form
Implementation requires new SKU management, menu configurations, order tracking, and backend integration for operations and analytics
decisions: Moving from subscription-only to include one-time purchase model across HelloFresh Group brands
Creating unified OTP user flow instead of separate microsites for different products
Implementing distinct cart and checkout processes for OTP orders
Launching in phases across different brands and regions starting September 2025

Determine frontend tracking requirements for OTP prospects

results.summary: Factor Form is introducing a one-time purchase (OTP) option alongside its current subscription-only model to capture customers who prefer flexible purchasing over recurring commitments. The initiative aims to increase conversion rates and revenue by 15%, addressing the fact that 49-58% of consumers across demographics prefer buying supplements as needed. The product will position subscriptions at lower prices while offering OTP at higher prices to incentivize recurring purchases.
key_points: Factor Form currently only offers subscription model, missing 49-58% of target customers who prefer as-needed purchases
13.3% of customers cancel due to excess product and 9.4% due to delivery frequency issues
Global dietary supplements market valued at $150+ billion with over 50% preferring one-time purchases for trials
Target success metric: 15% increase in total Factor Form revenue
OTP will be priced higher than subscriptions to incentivize recurring purchases
Implementation requires CSV upload for discount settings and voucher management strategy
Product experience will add 2-step selection process for OTP vs subscription on product level
decisions: Every Factor Form product will be available as both subscription and one-time purchase
Subscriptions will be positioned first and priced lower than OTP
Bundles and single products will be handled the same way with 2-step selection for OTP vs subscription
OTP vs subscription changes will not be supported in cart for MVP
Expiration dates will be set (e.g., 2 years) instead of unlimited for better auditability
PDP (Product Detail Page) will act as the master editor for all purchase options
action_items: POC on staging for CSV upload with 40% + 20% / 20% + 10% discount for 52 weeks
Define strategy for reactivations (CC + CRM + onsite)
Define strategy for new product additions based on voucher constraints
Define SOP for voucher maintenance including identifying customers with lapsed vouchers
Establish routine for updating discount setting duration (yearly basis)
Communicate increased OTP protein price to $39.99 to active protein customers via CRM
